summary: Two deadly accidents involving FAA-certified Boeing 737 MAX aircraft raised concerns about FAA's oversight of airplane manufacturers. We compared how FAA and the European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) certify new aircraft designs. Among other things, we found: Both rely on manufacturers to support the certification process, such as involving manufacturers in determining whether components comply with design standards EASA reviews elements of manufacturer certifications...
title: Aircraft Certification: Comparison of U.S. and European Processes for Approving New Designs of Commercial Transport Airplanes
